item.title: Assignment 02
item.description: Import the dataset reddit_vm.csv and explore the data library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.1 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.3 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.1.1 v dplyr 1.0.6 ## v tidyr 1.1.3 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 1.4.0 v forcats 0.5.1 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() vaccine <- read_csv("reddit_vm.csv") ## ## -- Column specification -------------------------------------------------------- ## cols( ## title = col_character(), ## score = col_double(), ## id = col_character(), ## url = col_character(), ## comms_num = col_double(), ## created = col_double(), ## body = col_character(), ## timestamp = col_datetime(format = "") ## ) head(vaccine) ## # A tibble: 6 x 8 ## title score id url comms_num created body timestamp ## <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <dttm> ## 1 Health Can~ 7 lt74~ https://w~ 0 1.

item.title: Data Wrangling using Tidyverse
item.description: Import the hotels.csv file library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.1 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.3 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.1.1 v dplyr 1.0.6 ## v tidyr 1.1.3 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 1.4.0 v forcats 0.5.1 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() hotels <- read_csv("hotels.csv") ## ## -- Column specification -------------------------------------------------------- ## cols( ## .

item.title: Assignment 01
item.description: Data Visualization Exercise 2 1. Temperature vs Pressure We will study the relationship between temperature and pressure through a density plot From the chart above we could easily found the temperature and pressure may have certain positive relation. However, we still need a larger sample to test our observations. We could also use another plot to do this data visualization: library(ggplot2) ggplot(data = datasets::pressure, aes(x = pressure)) + geom_boxplot() + labs(title = "Pressure vs Temperature", x = "Pressure(mercury in millimeters)", y = "Temperature(Celsius)") + theme(axis.

item.title: Data and Visualization
item.description: Data Visualization Exercise library(dplyr) starwars ## # A tibble: 87 x 14 ## name height mass hair_color skin_color eye_color birth_year sex gender ## <chr> <int> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> ## 1 Luke S~ 172 77 blond fair blue 19 male mascu~ ## 2 C-3PO 167 75 <NA> gold yellow 112 none mascu~ ## 3 R2-D2 96 32 <NA> white, bl~ red 33 none mascu~ ## 4 Darth ~ 202 136 none white yellow 41.
